page.title: 16FISHING AROUND ULLAPOOL.
page.content: Most anglers are coarse fishermen.They fish in reservoirs,lochs and rivers. Rods can be from 10-20 ft. long and bait ranges from cheese to bread and worms to maggots. When fishing for pike the rods are about 8 ft. and very strong.Pike are cunning fish.They lie in weeds,waiting for dead or injured fish which they gobble up in their powerful jaws. Because of these,steel traces have to be used.Pike are vicious and weigh up to 46lbs.so reels are barrel-type multipliers. To leger for pike,a dead trout is hooked about 2 ft. above a weight,to lie across the bottom. Float fishing is putting a live bait, such as roach or bream,1 1/2m.from the float,enabling the live bait to move, thus,attracting the pike.
